trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter"></xref> class itself is abstract and cannot be instantiated.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter> class provides a general base class from which control adapters can inherit.
This class provides a default implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface required for all adapters.
The default rendering implementation of the base class should be to render all child controls.
This allows the base class to be used as an adapter for composition controls.
Creates a new instance of the class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns the label identifier representing the **Back** label.
This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **Back** or to its localized translation.
Determines the optimum page weight for the device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The optimum page weight is calculated as 100 times the number of lines of characters.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page weight to use if the page weight cannot otherwise be determined.
The optimum page weight for the device.
Returns the label identifier representing the **Call** label.
This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **Call** or to its localized translation.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.Control%2A> property is an implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.Control%2A> property for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface, which gets or sets the control to which the adapter is attached.
For individual control adapters, you can create a strongly typed property to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.Control%2A> property.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.
Called by a control to create a templated user interface (UI).
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The default implementation calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.CreateTemplatedUI%2A> method of the corresponding control adapter, which can in turn call back the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.CreateTemplatedUI%2A> method or create its own device-specific templated UI.
If `true`, the instantiated templates bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request).
If `false`, the templates do not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Returns the device capabilities object associated with the request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is provided for convenience, and is equivalent to calling the browser using an <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest>, such as <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Browser%2A>.
The device capabilities object associated with the request.
Returns the localized default string for the label control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The following table shows the values for `labelID` parameters:
LabelID
Value
BackLabel
GoLabel
OKLabel
MoreLabel
OptionsLabel
NextLabel
PreviousLabel
LinkLabel
CallLabel
The identifier for the label.
The localized default string for the label control.
labelID is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the number of valid values.
Returns the label identifier representing the **Go** label.
This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **Go** or to its localized translation.
Returns `true` if the event was handled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter-specific.

If the control implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> method and receives a postback event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter is called.

If events sent to the control can vary depending on the target device, the control implementation of this method must call the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.HandlePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter.
This method returns `true` or `false`, indicating whether the device adapter handled the event.
It returns `false` by default.
Name of the event.
`true` if the event was handled; otherwise, `false`.
Accesses the approximate weight of a single item in the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A value of -1 indicates that the default weight for the element must be used.
The inheriting class must override this property.
For further information about overriding this property, see [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).
The approximate weight of a single item in the control.
Returns the label identifier representing the **Link** label.
This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **Link** or to its localized translation.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Loads the view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called when the control loads its private view state.
A device adapter can save the adapter-specific view for a control.
The current view state.
Returns `true` if the adapter handles loading the post data.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This method is called when a control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler?displayProperty=fullName> interface has its own <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A> method invoked.
Different devices might provide their data back to the calling server in different ways.
An example is the difference between how WML and HTML report back the results of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList>
Identifies the control.
Contains the collection of all incoming name values.
Provides a place to send data private to the control that might be required for loading of post data.
The control determines the type that is passed to the parameter.
Returns `true` if the required the object in privateControlData was changed, so the event can be raised.
`true` if the adapter handles loading the post data; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the label identifier representing the **More** label.
This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **More** or to its localized translation.

Use this field to set the default label for a control to **Next** or to its localized translation.

This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **OK** or to its localized translation.
Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You can override this method to set device-specific properties.
Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.
If this method is overridden in an inheriting class, you must call the base implementation.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Loads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.OnLoad%2A> method is inherited from the control's parent.

If the control is a mobile server control, this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control?displayProperty=fullName> class; if the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage>, this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page?displayProperty=fullName> class.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Called by the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.OnPreRender(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method, to perform adapter-specific work prior to rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Unloads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> base class implementation calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.OnUnload%2A> method of the control adapter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage> base class implementation calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.OnUnload%2A> method of the page adapter.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Returns the label identifier representing the **Options** label.
This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **Options** or to its localized translation.
Returns the page associated with the device adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Equivalent to calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.MobilePage%2A> property of a control.
The page associated with the device adapter.
an attempt was made to set this property in the base class.
You may want to override this method in a derived class.
Returns the label identifier representing the **Previous** label.
This field is constant.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this field to set the default label for a control to **Previous** or its localized translation.
Called by the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)"></xref> method to perform rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter> class, this method renders all the children of the control.
The text writer to receive output.
Renders children of the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified writer.
This method is called when the control saves its private view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An adapter can save adapter-specific state for a control.
If no such functionality is required, the adapter returns `null`.
`Null` in all cases.
Returns the style object associated with the control to which the device adapter is attached.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style object associated with the control to which the device adapter is attached.
Gets or sets the approximate weight of the control, in characters.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is used for form pagination.
A value of -1 indicates that the default weight for the element must be used.
For further information, see [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).
The approximate weight of the control, in characters
